text: Bomarea elegans is a species of flowering plants in the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it occurs in the forests and páramo of the Andes. It is threatened by fire, grazing, and mining.Mogollón, H. and N. Pitman. 2003. Bomarea elegans. In: IUCN 2012. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2012.2. title: Bomarea elegans
